N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1647-7.4 - General ledger trial balance

State Regulations

After all subsidiary ledgers have been balanced to the
respective general ledger accounts, a pre- closing trial balance of the general
ledger shall be taken to prove that the sum of the debit balances equals the
sum of the credit balances. The subsidy to be taken into income shall then be
computed in accordance with Part 1648 and an entry prepared and posted. The
income and expense analysis ledgers may now be ruled off. It is recommended
that a post- closing trial balance of the general ledger be prepared when the
closing entries prescribed in section
1647-7.5, below, have been posted. Copies of all trial balances shall be preserved for use of the division's
auditor. See Exhibit 1 of Appendix S-12 for form to be used for trial balance
and reconciliation of funds. Notes
